content:
• Wednesday, June 13, 2012
  • LEAF

    Demand Media (DMD +6.7%) caught a bid in afternoon trading after announcing it was the only...

    Demand Media (DMD +6.7%) caught a bid in afternoon trading after announcing it was the only applicant for 16 of the new domain name suffixes opened up by ICANN. The suffixes include .actor, .democrat, .republican, and .social. Demand also applied for ten suffixes that have other applicants, including .bar, .map, and .wow.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) confirms it settled a shareholder lawsuit that arose from its...

    Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) confirms it settled a shareholder lawsuit that arose from its 2009 acquisition of a college bookstore chain owned by chairman Leonard Riggio and his wife. WSJ reports Riggio agreed to a $22.75M reduction in the $596M purchase price, of which $150M was still owed by BKS in the form of a loan from Riggio.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • CTRP

    Ctrip.com (NASDAQ:CTRP) +3.8% AH after announcing a $300M stock buyback program, good for...

    Ctrip.com (NASDAQ:CTRP) +3.8% AH after announcing a $300M stock buyback program, good for repurchasing 12.7% of outstanding shares at current levels. Ctrip says it will fund the buyback with available cash, but adds some of the cash will come from dividends its receives from its Chinese subsidiaries. Those dividends are subject to a 5% tax, which will hurt the company's EPS by $0.10. Ctrip shares have fallen ~40% from early March levels. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • KFY

    Korn/Ferry International (NYSE:KFY): FQ4 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $207.6M (+1%...

    Korn/Ferry International (NYSE:KFY): FQ4 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $207.6M (+1% Y/Y) beats by $15M. Shares -2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • RPTP

    Raptor Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RPTP) +5% AH after announcing FDA acceptance of its New Drug...

    Raptor Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RPTP) +5% AH after announcing FDA acceptance of its New Drug Application for RP103 for the potential treatment of nephropathic cystinosis.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • CW

    Curtiss-Wright (CW +1.5%) suddenly cancels participation in a Deutsche Bank conference, sending...

    Curtiss-Wright (CW +1.5%) suddenly cancels participation in a Deutsche Bank conference, sending shares up as investors await news of CW's "unanticipated business matter." Last month, the provider of motion-control, flow-control and metal-treatment products to various industries said it was committed to reinvesting in its business and growing through acquisitions.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • AXP

    American Express (AXP -2.7%) after Vice Chair Gilligan - speaking at a conference - says...

    American Express (AXP -2.7%) after Vice Chair Gilligan - speaking at a conference - says billings growth through the quarter ending in May was 9-10%, slower than the year's first quarter, with the strong greenback among the reasons for the weakness.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • SMG

    Scotts Miracle-Gro (SMG -6.6%) is among the day's big losers after warning it expects to fall...

    Scotts Miracle-Gro (SMG -6.6%) is among the day's big losers after warning it expects to fall short of earlier guidance. SunTrust analysts say the results are doubly disappointing after "a disastrous 2011 garden season," adding "not only does this bring the health of the category into question, but we also believe Scotts will need lower ad spending and stepped-up pricing to improve bottom-line results."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • CMPR

    VistaPrint (VPRT -8.7%) is downgraded to Underweight by Barclays, which also cuts its price...

    VistaPrint (VPRT -8.7%) is downgraded to Underweight by Barclays, which also cuts its price target to $29 from $35, based on the likelihood of FQ4 and FY 2013 guidance will fall short of estimates. The firm says fewer searches related to VPRT’s services and a stronger dollar could lead to weakening results.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • SHLM

    A. Schulman (SHLM -5.5%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Gabelli, which cites the plastic...

    A. Schulman (SHLM -5.5%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Gabelli, which cites the plastic maker's "susbstantial" exposure to debt-scarred Europe. SHLM draws ~70% of its revenue from Europe, according to Gabelli; since April, the stock has shed ~32%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • XSRAF

    Xstrata (OTC:XSRAF) shareholders can blame Martin Sorrell for the stock's 5% swoon in London...

    Xstrata (OTC:XSRAF) shareholders can blame Martin Sorrell for the stock's 5% swoon in London trading today. The merger of Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF) and Xstrata is contingent on shareholders approving a package of incentives for Mick Davis and his Xstrata colleagues worth at least £217M, and the vote against Sorrell's big payday makes the deal look even more unlikely.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake (CHK -2.9%) is cut to Market Perform at Sanford Bernstein, which expects low natural...

    Chesapeake (CHK -2.9%) is cut to Market Perform at Sanford Bernstein, which expects low natural gas prices to continue to pressure shares and Q2 earnings as "potentially a headwind to the stock." Bernstein sees value elsewhere with EOG Resources (NYSE:EOG), Noble Energy (NYSE:NBL) and Apache (NYSE:APA).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (DNDN +19.8%) skyrockets to $7.49/share amidst rumors Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY) is looking to...

    Dendreon (DNDN +19.8%) skyrockets to $7.49/share amidst rumors Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY) is looking to acquire the company for $11/share. Also, Summer Street is starting coverage with a Buy and $18 PT, arguing the Street has "factored in an extremely bear-case scenario" amidst concerns about weaker-than-expected sales of its Provenge prostate cancer drug. It sees Provenge growth and a "turnaround led by new management" driving shares higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • PGR

    Progressive (PGR -4%) shares slip after the vehicle insurer reports a sharp increase in premiums...

    Progressive (PGR -4%) shares slip after the vehicle insurer reports a sharp increase in premiums paid out for claims last month, buttressing recent concerns about the company's near-term prospects. Net premiums written in May totaled $1.217B, up 7% Y/Y, while net income was $43.9M, down 41% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • NRG

    GenOn Energy (GEN -2.1%) is upgraded to Neutral from Sell at UBS, which notes shares have...

    GenOn Energy (GEN -2.1%) is upgraded to Neutral from Sell at UBS, which notes shares have dramatically lagged peers Calpine (NYSE:CPN) and NRG. The firm believes much of the weakness may be tied to underwhelming capacity results from May's 2015-16 auction, and forthcoming petitions filed by generators could yet support shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • FTNT

    More on UBS' upgrade of Fortinet (FTNT +2.4%): Analyst Brent Thill, who is keeping his PT at...

    More on UBS' upgrade of Fortinet (FTNT +2.4%): Analyst Brent Thill, who is keeping his PT at $28, thinks Fortinet looks compelling thanks to its recent selloff. While worried about its exposure to Europe (35% of sales), Thill argues Fortinet trades at a discount to rivals Check Point and SourceFire a forward enterprise value/sales basis, and points out security names tends to outperform in a weak macro/IT spending environment.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS +2.6%) perk up after a report breaks tipping off that the company...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS +2.6%) perk up after a report breaks tipping off that the company will settle a lawsuit over the sale of the company's textbook unit.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    More from Dell's (DELL-OLD +4.1%) 2012 analyst meeting: The company forecasts its enterprise...

    More from Dell's (DELL-OLD +4.1%) 2012 analyst meeting: The company forecasts its enterprise solutions division will average 10% annual growth until FY16, and will help produce a 13%+ operating margin for the company. Dell is shooting for a 5%+ op. margin for its PC business, and reiterates it will focus on profits over unit share. Dell's revenues have been declining thanks to weak PC sales and a tough IT spending environment. (presentation - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • LGF.A

    Shares of Lions Gate (LGF +1.9%) gain ground with news out that the company will release a...

    Shares of Lions Gate (LGF +1.9%) gain ground with news out that the company will release a digitally-remastered version of the second movie in the Hunger Games series for IMAX release in November of 2013. Instead of simply blowing up the movie for the larger screen format, part of it will be filmed utilizing special 3D cameras which may add to the buzz a bit as it's released.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • CECO

    Shares of Career Education (CECO -6.6%) fall after an accreditor issues a show-cause notice that...

    Shares of Career Education (CECO -6.6%) fall after an accreditor issues a show-cause notice that requires the company to show cause as to why their accreditation shouldn't be withdrawn amid accusations of improper placement practices.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • YOKU

    Youku.com (YOKU +3.4%) and merger partner Tudou (TUDO +2.8%) rally after Nomura's Jin Yoon...

    Youku.com (YOKU +3.4%) and merger partner Tudou (TUDO +2.8%) rally after Nomura's Jin Yoon reports on a recent meeting with Youku's management. Among management's comments: Bandwidth costs are expected to remain steady; Youku has seen a "rationalization pattern" for content acquisition prices, which have recently soared; and Tudou's ad prices remain ~20% below Youku's.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • PDH

    PetroLogistics (PDH -3.3%) shares aren't being helped by a new Buy rating awarded by UBS, which...

    PetroLogistics (PDH -3.3%) shares aren't being helped by a new Buy rating awarded by UBS, which believes "longer term, high oil prices and the North American shale gas story supports the company’s performance." Morgan Stanley starts coverage at Outperform, seeing propane staying weak through H1 2013 and propylene recovering over the next six months.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • CHK

    Aubrey McClendon may be losing his title of chairman, but he seems poised to keep his powers:...

    Aubrey McClendon may be losing his title of chairman, but he seems poised to keep his powers: Reuters reports the Chesapeake (CHK -2.5%) board has changed the bylaws to allow the CEO to keep powers he held as Chairman. McClendon and the still-unnamed chairman each will be able to call special meetings of shareholders and the board, leaving governance types scratching their heads.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 9 Comments
  • SWK

    Stanley Black & Decker (SWK -1.1%) has placed its hardware and home-improvement unit up for...

    Stanley Black & Decker (SWK -1.1%) has placed its hardware and home-improvement unit up for sale, according to the WSJ. Due to the company's disparate product lines, the sum of its parts are worth more than the company itself.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • ARNA

    Arena's (NASDAQ:ARNA) shares have been flying recently and are up another 3.1% today. While the...

    Arena's (NASDAQ:ARNA) shares have been flying recently and are up another 3.1% today. While the FDA is expected to soon approve Arena's weight loss drug lorcaserin, market players aren't totally sure why shares are rocketing. One reason could be short covering, and another optimism that the FDA approval will come without the need for a risk-management plan.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 11 Comments
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS +13.6%) soars after Sidoti starts coverage with a Buy and $10 PT. Shares continue...

    Rambus (RMBS +13.6%) soars after Sidoti starts coverage with a Buy and $10 PT. Shares continue to trade at a fraction of what they were worth before Rambus lost its multi-year antitrust suit against Micron and Hynix.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • GEVO

    Gevo (GEVO +2.4%) says a U.S. District Court judge issued a temporary order allowing the...

    Gevo (GEVO +2.4%) says a U.S. District Court judge issued a temporary order allowing the renewable chemicals and biofuels company to continue the startup of its Luverne Plant, the world's first commercial biobased isobutanol production plant, as planned.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • VRSN

    Verisign (VRSN +2.2%) rallies as applications pour in for domain names tied to new suffixes. The...

    Verisign (VRSN +2.2%) rallies as applications pour in for domain names tied to new suffixes. The new suffixes could provide a boost to Verisign's domain name registration business. Also, Verisign today is announcing its participation in a program that will create transliterations for .com and .net domain names based on non-Latin scripts such as Arabic, Indian, and Simplified Chinese.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAL

    US Airways (LCC +7.8%) trades higher after making a play to accelerate its merger with AMR...

    US Airways (LCC +7.8%) trades higher after making a play to accelerate its merger with AMR (AAMRQ.PK). Tomorrow, the company hosts its annual shareholder meeting where more clues on its merger plans could be disclosed.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • REGN

    Regeneron (REGN -8.5%) dives after privately-owned Opthotech reports positive Phase 2b results...

    Regeneron (REGN -8.5%) dives after privately-owned Opthotech reports positive Phase 2b results for its Fovista drug. Fovista, working in tandem with Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY) Lucentis, treats a form of macular degeneration, and stands to compete with Regeneron's Eylea. Lucentis. Jefferies is defending Regeneron, arguing Fovista could just as well work in tandem with Eylea.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • CIE

    Cobalt Energy (CIE -4.7%) shares slide after the company's update on its drilling operations in...

    Cobalt Energy (CIE -4.7%) shares slide after the company's update on its drilling operations in the Gulf of Mexico and West Africa shows its well on Canyon Block 814 in the Gulf did not encounter commercial hydrocarbons, and operations are underway to plug and abandon the wellbore.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (FTNT +3.9%) rallies on an upgrade to Buy from UBS. In spite of providing healthy Q1...

    Fortinet (FTNT +3.9%) rallies on an upgrade to Buy from UBS. In spite of providing healthy Q1 results and Q2/2012 guidance, shares of the richly-valued IT security hardware vendor had fallen 27% since early April

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • AMZN

    Whole Food Markets (WFM -0.9%) comes back a bit from daily lows after more commentary from the...

    Whole Food Markets (WFM -0.9%) comes back a bit from daily lows after more commentary from the William Blair Growth Stock Conference (webcast) is digested. The trading volatility is being partially attributed to confusion over the company's guidance, initially seen as a downward revision, but now considered in-line after adjusting for an extra week.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • CTCT

    Constant Contact (CTCT -8.4%) dives after announcing it has acquired SinglePlatform, developer...

    Constant Contact (CTCT -8.4%) dives after announcing it has acquired SinglePlatform, developer of a site that allows small businesses to have their information published on numerous sites/apps. The acquisition price includes $65M in guaranteed cash, as well as $15M-$35M in potential milestone and retention payments. CTCT expects SinglePlatform to contribute over $10M in 2013 revenue, but sees the deal hurting 2012 profits, and doesn't expect it to be accretive until the end of 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • AMZN

    Execs with Whole Foods Market (WFM -3.1%) are on the mike at the William Blair Growth Stock...

    Execs with Whole Foods Market (WFM -3.1%) are on the mike at the William Blair Growth Stock Conference (webcast). Though the company says it has plans to open between 28 and 32 stores next year and maintains it has the potential to operate about a thousand eventually, investors may be disappointed with that growth trek as they sell off shares on larger-than-normal trading volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 3 Comments
  • MPO

    Midstates Petroleum (MPO -17%) shares sink after disclosing an update on pending litigation with...

    Midstates Petroleum (MPO -17%) shares sink after disclosing an update on pending litigation with Clovelly Oil, stating that "an adverse court decision could result in a material adverse effect on our financial condition, future planned operations and/or cash flow." Also, an amended credit agreement increases the size of MPO's revolving credit facility from $300M to $500M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 3 Comments
  • AONEQ

    What short squeezes give to depressed stocks, they often quickly take away. A123 Systems (AONE...

    What short squeezes give to depressed stocks, they often quickly take away. A123 Systems (AONE -17.1%) and First Solar (FSLR -6%) are each returning a big chunk of yesterday's massive gains (I, II). Wunderlich's comments are contributing to A123's decline, while First Solar's drop is partly due to a cautious JPMorgan note that argues yesterday's rally didn't feature "much, if any, structural long buying."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • SVU

    Supervalu (SVU +1.7%) could attract a buyout after its share price fell to a 30-year low this...

    Supervalu (SVU +1.7%) could attract a buyout after its share price fell to a 30-year low this week, according to Barclays. On the plus side, the company is expected to turn a profit for the first time in three years and boasts the industry’s highest free cash flow yield, but the downer is that its debt is 7X its market cap.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • RL

    AAII's Wayne Thorp lines up Ralph Lauren (RL -1.4%) as his "Sell of the Week" on his view that...

    AAII's Wayne Thorp lines up Ralph Lauren (RL -1.4%) as his "Sell of the Week" on his view that the company's current valuation doesn't reflect in full the warning from execs that sales could slump.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • JVA

    More on Coffee Holding (NASDAQ:JVA): Sees customers holding back on orders while they wait for...

    More on Coffee Holding (NASDAQ:JVA): Sees customers holding back on orders while they wait for lower coffee prices with the market trending lower. Cost of net sales increased 6.6% Y/Y to 96.3% of sales on higher costs for green coffee and hedging losses. Shares -17.9% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) +2% after Evercore upgrades shares to Equal Weight on expectations the...

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) +2% after Evercore upgrades shares to Equal Weight on expectations the company's June 26 Unleashed event will result in some needed new titles being unveiled - 10 new products were released at last October's Unleashed event. Also, JPMorgan is defending the beaten-down company, arguing Zynga's flailing bookings growth can re-accelerate this year, and noting its share lockup expirations finally end in August. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • SLP

    Simulations Plus (NASDAQ:SLP) +5.3% premarket after the developer of software for use in...

    Simulations Plus (NASDAQ:SLP) +5.3% premarket after the developer of software for use in pharmaceutical research says it signed a collaboration agreement with an unnamed company to extend and enhance its oral cavity dosing model within its GastroPlus simulation-software program.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • JVA

    Coffee Holding (NASDAQ:JVA): FQ2 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.29. Revenue of $37M (-0.5% Y/Y)....

    Coffee Holding (NASDAQ:JVA): FQ2 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.29. Revenue of $37M (-0.5% Y/Y). Shares -16.2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM

  • Market preview: Stocks are set to open down as futures extend earlier losses following declines...

    Market preview: Stocks are set to open down as futures extend earlier losses following declines in retail sales and producer prices, with S&P Benchmark futures -0.5%. Much of Europe is down also, although Spain is higher and its 10-year bond yields, as well as those of Italy, are tame. Later: Jamie Dimon goes to Washington, Business Inventories
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • END

    Endeavour International (NYSE:END) -5.8% premarket after saying it will offer an undisclosed...

    Endeavour International (NYSE:END) -5.8% premarket after saying it will offer an undisclosed number of shares to raise funds for its current development operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • KITD

    Premarket gainers: OTC:KITD +10%. RBY +6%. Losers: SMG -15%. AONE -13%. END -7%.

    Premarket gainers: OTC:KITD +10%. RBY +6%.
    Losers: SMG -15%. AONE -13%. END -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • LEU

    USEC (USU) +57.6% premarket after reaching a $350M agreement with the U.S. Department of Energy...

    USEC (USU) +57.6% premarket after reaching a $350M agreement with the U.S. Department of Energy for cooperative research, development and demonstration program to confirm the technical readiness of the American Centrifuge, which it calls "the next-generation U.S. uranium enrichment technology."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM | 2 Comments
  • VQ

    Venoco (NYSE:VQ) +3.5% premarket after extending the financing date to July 20 in its...

    Venoco (NYSE:VQ) +3.5% premarket after extending the financing date to July 20 in its going-private agreement. Stifel Nicolaus upgrades shares to Buy from Hold, saying while skeptics may view the extension and news of a "signed term sheet" as an attempt to put the company into play, the firm believes visibility on private financing is improving.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) moves up 1.8% premarket after Bill Ackman defends the company's...

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) moves up 1.8% premarket after Bill Ackman defends the company's turnaround plan and hints private equity firms are sniffing around. Shares closed yesterday on their 52-week low, with CEO Ron Johnson a day away from his one-year anniversary on the job.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • KITD

    Kit Digital (OTC:KITD +6.8%) is in talks with several potential suitors and expects to announce...

    Kit Digital (OTC:KITD +6.8%) is in talks with several potential suitors and expects to announce progress in the discussions "in the near future." However, the video technology provider fails to reach an agreement with 8% shareholder JEC Capital Partners over board appointments.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • NUE

    Nucor (NYSE:NUE) -2.6% premarket after issuing downside Q2 guidance. The steel maker sees Q2 EPS...

    Nucor (NYSE:NUE) -2.6% premarket after issuing downside Q2 guidance. The steel maker sees Q2 EPS of $0.35-$0.40 including a $0.09/share impairment charge vs. $0.55 consensus estimate, citing challenging conditions in Europe and competition from imported steel.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • MCD

    Goldman Sachs downgrades McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) to Neutral from Buy on its forecast that the...

    Goldman Sachs downgrades McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) to Neutral from Buy on its forecast that the company's same-store sales will remain pressured. Analysts lower their 2012-2014 EPS estimates and trim the price target on MCD to $92 from $100. Shares -1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:38 AM | 4 Comments
  • AONEQ

    Wunderlich tips off that it expects A123 Systems (AONE) to give back a good portion of...

    Wunderlich tips off that it expects A123 Systems (AONE) to give back a good portion of yesterday's gains as investors realize that its "breakthrough" lithium ion battery could take years to see production. Analysts with the firm don't pull their punches, calling the new technology the "dime a dozen" variety with very little near-term impact. Shares -5.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:13 AM
